isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - FULLER 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - ASSEMBLE - AUXILIARY SECTION

note.para: To aid in reassembling the auxiliary section, use a fixture that will hold the countershafts in the proper positions. The dimensions of the fixture are shown in Figure 113. The fixture is constructed from a 2 inch x 12 inch x 24 inch piece of wood.

step1.para: For timing purposes, identify and mark with toolmaker's dye the two teeth on each countershaft that are identified with a "0" ( Figure 114).

figure.caption: Figure 114. Mark Two Teeth on Each Countershaft

step1.para: Place the countershafts in the fixture (or on a clean, flat surface if you don't have a fixture) with the marked teeth turned to the middle of the fixture ( Figure 115).
Position a 2 inch high spacer, such as a socket, between the countershafts ( Figure 115). (If a fixture is not used, a 3 inch spacer is required.)
Install the synchronizer assembly on the output shaft. The low range synchronizer ring (side with external friction material) must be facing the auxiliary mainshaft reduction gear ( Figure 116).

figure.caption: Figure 116. Install Synchronizer Assembly on Output Shaft

step1.para: Match the timing marks on the auxiliary mainshaft reduction gear with the timing marks on the countershafts. The output shaft will rest on the spacer ( Figure 117).
With the round hole in the range yoke bar facing up, slide the range yoke assembly into the groove on the range synchronizer (Figure 117).

figure.caption: Figure 117. Match Timing Marks and Slide Range Yoke Assembly into Groove

step1.para: Lightly oil the bearing bores on the auxiliary housing, and place the auxiliary housing over the countershaft assemblies and the output shaft assembly ( Figure 118). Refer to GROUP 10 - LUBRICATION in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
Install the output shaft bearing race in the housing bore ( Figure 118).
Make sure the output shaft bearing inner spacer is on the output shaft. (The spacer should have been installed when the output shaft components were assembled).

warning.para: Wear insulated gloves or similar protection to prevent possible burns when handling hot components.

step1.para: Heat the rear output bearing cone (or use an appropriate driver) and install the outer bearing cone, tapered side down, on the shaft ( Figure 118).

figure.caption: Figure 118. Install Output Shaft Bearing Race and Outer Bearing Cone

step1.para: Install a new gasket.
Use the marks made during disassembly as a guide, install the rear bearing cover in the same position as when removed ( Figure 119).

note.para: The rear bearing cover can be installed in two positions 180 degrees opposite each other. If the rear bearing cover is not installed in the same position in which it was removed, the speedometer cable may not reach the speedometer after the transmission is installed in the vehicle. If the speedometer cannot be connected, the auxiliary bearing cover must be removed and reassembled properly.

step1.para: Apply Loctite 242 or equivalent to the six (6) rear bearing cover retaining bolts and install them. Tighten the bolts to 54 to 61 Nm (40 to 45 ft-lbs).
Insert the countershaft bearing races in their bores ( Figure 120).

figure.caption: Figure 120. Insert Countershaft Bearing Races in Their Bores

note.para: If the original parts are being re-used and installed in their original locations, the shims can also be installed at this time.

step1.para: If shimming will be required, temporarily install the auxiliary countershaft shim and support tools. Final installation and shimming of the countershafts will be done after the auxiliary section is installed on front section ( Figure 121).

figure.caption: Figure 121. Install Countershaft Shim and Support Tools

note.para: If shimming will not be required, the auxiliary countershaft bearing covers can be installed at this time. However, the shim tools will help prevent the countershafts from dropping excessively when the auxiliary section is installed.

step1.para: Secure the auxiliary section in a vise with brass jaw protectors.
On the auxiliary housing back, install the range alignment lock cover and O-ring. Rotate the cover to the unlock position, and secure the cover in place with a bolt ( Figure 122, left).
Install the O-ring over the output shaft, and insert it against the output bearing ( Figure 122, right).
Install the speedometer rotor seal/sleeve ( Figure 122, right).
Install the output yoke.

Inspect the output nut for damage. If the nylon locking material is damaged or excessively worn, replace the nut. The nylon locking material must be in good condition to prevent the nut from loosening during operation.
Lightly oil the threads and install the output yoke nut. Tighten the nut to 610 to 678 Nm (450 to 500 ft-lbs).

figure.caption: Figure 122. Secure Cover (Left), and Install Speedometer Rotor Seal/Sleeve (Right)
